summary: Antonio Veciana was the founder of Alpha 66, an anti-Castro Cuban exile group. He is of interest to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence (SSCI) and the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in relation to inquiries into the assassinations of President John F. Kennedy and Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. The SSCI requested information on Veciana and related Cuban matters, leading to internal discussions within the NSA regarding the handling of the committee's request, including withholding certain documents. Veciana's connections to various organizations and U.S. agencies are being investigated. He is also linked to William Gaudet, and his biographical information is of interest to the CIA.
significance: Antonio Veciana's significance in the JFK context lies in his connections to anti-Castro Cuban exile groups and potential links to Cuban intelligence networks, making him a person of interest in investigations into the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. The interest from both the SSCI and HSCA suggests his potential involvement or knowledge related to the assassination.
